citation.article-title: Taxonomy of Australian clinical isolates of the genus Photorhabdus and proposal of Photorhabdus asymbiotica subsp. asymbiotica subsp. nov. and P. asymbiotica subsp. australis subsp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Photorhabdus asymbiotica subsp. australis subsp. nov.
Photorhabdus asymbiotica subsp. australis (aus.tra′lis. L. fem. adj. australis southern; this subspecies was detected in the southern hemisphere).
Yellow or no pigment; weakly pigmented.
Most isolates are positive for DNase and most are negative for aesculin hydrolysis.
Most isolates produce acid from gluconate; variable for acid production from aesculin and negative for trehalose.
Annular haemolysis is variable on sheep blood and horse blood agars.
Most isolates are negative for Tween 60 and Tween 80 esterases and most grow on myo-inositol.
Natural habitat is uncertain; all isolates were obtained from human clinical specimens in Australia.
The GenBank accession numbers of the 16S rRNA and gyrB gene sequences of the type strain are AY280572 and AY278496, respectively.
